translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom in this way, they should investigate how all phenomena are empty by nature, and they should do so in such a way that their minds do not engage with any phenomenon.

analyzed: par bgyi'o // bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur lags so //

translated: ‚ÄúThat knowledge of all aspects is inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality,

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang /

translated: the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of beginning and end, the emptiness of nonrepudiation, and the emptiness of inherent existence.

translated: because all dharmas are empty, because of the emptiness of own-marks, because of the emptiness of non-apprehension, because of the emptiness of non-existence, because of the emptiness of own-being, and because of the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan mar brjod pa ma lags te /

analyzed: mtshan ma gang lags she na /

analyzed: gzugs ni mtshan ma lags so //

analyzed: mig ni mtshan ma lags so //

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni mtshan ma lags so //

original: gzugs ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: gzugs ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: Form is a mark.

original: sgra dang / @124a *//
analyzed: sgra dang / @124a *//
translated: Sound,

analyzed: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are signs.

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mtshan ma lags so //

analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mtshan ma lags so //

translated: Ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact are signs.

analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba ni mtshan ma lags so //

analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang /
translated: the feeling that arises from the union of the body, touch, and body-consciousness,

analyzed: sa'i khams ni mtshan ma lags so //

analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni mtshan ma lags so //

original: ma rig pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni mtshan ma lags so //

original: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye @124b ba dang / rga shi ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye @124b ba dang / rga shi ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: Formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and old age and death are signs.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of awakening, the path, the perfections, the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma mchis pa dang / smon pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa dang /
translated: the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the distinct attributes of a buddha, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and nonapplication,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang; gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / chos nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang; gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: the dharma-constituent, the true nature of dharmas, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the meditative stabilization of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateway, and the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateway are signs;

original: yi ge rnams ni mtshan ma lags so //üîΩgcig brjod pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni mtshan ma lags so // gcig brjod pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: letters are signs;üîΩthe utterance of one is a sign;

original: gnyis brjod pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: gnyis brjod pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: the utterance of two is a sign;

original: tha dad pa brjod pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: tha dad pa brjod pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: The expression of difference is a causal sign.

original: mngon par shes pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni mtshan ma lags so //
translated: The superknowledges are causal signs.

original: gzungs kyi sgo ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad ni mtshan ma lags te /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad ni mtshan ma lags te /
translated: All the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways and the gateways of meditative stabilization are causal signs.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa zhes bgyi'o //
translated: That is called an affliction.

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mtshan mar gzung bar bgyi ba zhig lags na ni kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs de bstan pa 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la dad pa thob par mi 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de mtshan mar gzung bar bgyi ba zhig lags na ni kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs de bstan pa 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de la dad pa thob par mi 'gyur lags so //
translated: If the perfection of wisdom were something to be apprehended as a causal sign, then the wandering mendicant Subhadra would not have attained faith in that knowledge of an omniscient one in this teaching.

original: dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is faith?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pa dang / rtog pa dang / mos pa dang / rten pa dang / sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang / @125a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pa dang / rtog pa dang / mos pa dang / rten pa dang / sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang / @125a *//
translated: confidence in the perfection of wisdom, understanding, belief, reliance, thought, evaluation,

original: dpyod pa ste /üîΩde'ang mtshan ma'i tshul du ma lags /
analyzed: dpyod pa ste / de'ang mtshan ma'i tshul du ma lags /
translated: and investigation.üîΩAnd that is not in the manner of a causal sign.

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i tshul du'ang ma lags so //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i tshul du'ang ma lags so //
translated: It is also not in the manner of a signless.

original: de ltar de ni mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / gzung ba ma mchis par gzung bar bgyi ba lags te /
analyzed: de ltar de ni mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / gzung ba ma mchis par gzung bar bgyi ba lags te /
translated: In this way, it is to be apprehended as signless, as not apprehended, and as not ungrasped.

original: kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la mos nas /
analyzed: kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'di la mos nas /
translated: The wandering mendicant, the naked ascetic, having aspired to this gnosis of omniscience,

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang bas nyi tshe ba'i shes pas zhugs te /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang bas nyi tshe ba'i shes pas zhugs te /
translated: has entered through a limited understanding that follows through faith.

original: de zhugs nas gzugs yongs su ma bzung /
analyzed: de zhugs nas gzugs yongs su ma bzung /
translated: Having entered, he has not apprehended form,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung lags so; ;de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su ma bzung lags so; ;de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: and likewise has not apprehended feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness. And why?

original: 'di ltar des rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa po ma dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar des rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa po ma dmigs pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because he has not apprehended a grasper in all phenomena that are empty of their own marks.

original: de'ang ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar des shes pa de thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa lags par nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: 'di ltar des shes pa de thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa lags par nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: Because he has not seen that attainment of that knowledge and realization internally.

original: phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: I do not see it externally.

original: shes pa de thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa lags par phyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: shes pa de thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa lags par phyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: I do not see it internally or externally as the attainment or realization of that knowledge.

original: shes pa de thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa lags par gzhan du'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: shes pa de thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa lags par gzhan du'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: I do not see it elsewhere as the attainment or realization of that knowledge.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar des gang gis rtogs par bgyid pa dang / gang rtogs par bgyid pa dang / gang rtogs par bgyi ba'i chos de ma dmigs /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di ltar des gang gis rtogs par bgyid pa dang / gang rtogs par bgyid pa dang / gang rtogs par bgyi ba'i chos de ma dmigs /

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: It is because I do not apprehend or see any dharma by which one could realize, which one could realize, or which one could realize.

original: @125b shes pa de gzugs kyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: @125b shes pa de gzugs kyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: I do not see that knowledge within form.

original: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /

original: shes pa de gzugs kyi phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: shes pa de gzugs kyi phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: I do not see that knowledge externally in form.

original: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: He does not see consciousness as external to feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: shes pa de gzugs kyi nang dang phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: shes pa de gzugs kyi nang dang phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: He does not see consciousness as internal to form.üîΩHe does not see consciousness as external to form.üîΩHe does not see consciousness as internal to feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i nang dang phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i nang dang phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: He does not see consciousness as external to feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi slad du shes pa de gzugs las gzhan du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi slad du shes pa de gzugs las gzhan du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /

original: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las gzhan du'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: shes pa de tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las gzhan du'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: He does not see consciousness as other than feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin du shes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar gyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar gyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: Similarly, he does not see consciousness as internal to the applications of mindfulness.

original: shes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha'i phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /üîΩshes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha'i phyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: shes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha'i phyi rol du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong / shes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha'i phyi nang du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: He does not see that consciousness as external to the very limit of reality.üîΩHe does not see that consciousness as internal and external to the very limit of reality.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi slad du shes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha' las gzhan du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi slad du shes pa de yang dag pa'i mtha' las gzhan du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: He does not see that consciousness as other than the very limit of reality, because of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, and the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena.

original: rnam grangs 'di la kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs mos par gyur te /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'di la kun tu rgyu bzo sbyangs mos par gyur te /
translated: In this regard, the wandering mendicant Upati·π£ya became convinced.

original: de 'dir mos nas dad pas rjes su @126a *//
analyzed: de 'dir mos nas dad pas rjes su @126a *//
translated: Having become convinced, he followed the Dharma by faith.

original: 'brang bas chos nyid tshad mar bgyi ste /üîΩchos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: 'brang bas chos nyid tshad mar bgyi ste / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la zhugs par gyur te /
translated: He took the Dharma as his authority.üîΩHe entered into the wisdom of omniscience, because he did not apprehend any phenomena.

original: de de ltar mos nas des chos gang yang mtshan ma ma mchis par yid la bgyid pa'i slad du chos gang yang yongs su gzung ba ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de de ltar mos nas des chos gang yang mtshan ma ma mchis par yid la bgyid pa'i slad du chos gang yang yongs su gzung ba ma mchis lags so //
translated: Having become convinced in this way, he did not apprehend any phenomena, because he attended to all phenomena as signless.

original: chos thams cad gzung du ma mchis pa dang / gtang du ma mchis pa'i slad du /üîΩdes gang yongs su gzung bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung du ma mchis pa dang / gtang du ma mchis pa'i slad du / des gang yongs su gzung bar bgyi ba'am /

original: gtang bar bgyi ba'i chos gang yang ma dmigs te /
analyzed: gtang bar bgyi ba'i chos gang yang ma dmigs te /
translated: He does not apprehend any dharma that he should grasp orüîΩabandon.

original: chos thams cad la rlom sems ma mchis pa'i slad du de ni mya ngan las 'das pas kyang rlom sems su 'gyur ba ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rlom sems ma mchis pa'i slad du de ni mya ngan las 'das pas kyang rlom sems su 'gyur ba ma mchis lags so //
translated: Because all phenomena are without conceit, he does not even have conceit in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du gang gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du yongs su mi 'dzin pa de ni gzhan gyi pha rol tu mchi bas /
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du gang gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du yongs su mi 'dzin pa de ni gzhan gyi pha rol tu mchi bas /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //üîΩde ni smon lam dag yongs su ma rdzogs shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so // de ni smon lam dag yongs su ma rdzogs shing /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su ma rdzogs kyi bar du bar ma dor yongs su @126b mya ngan las mi 'da' lags so //

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /

original: gal te mig gi 'dus te reg pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
analyzed: gal te mig gi 'dus te reg pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
translated: if they stand in eye contact and know and love it,

analyzed: gal te rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid @132b kyi 'dus te reg pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
translated: If they were to abide in and understand the composite of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind,

analyzed: gal te mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /

analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin; bde ba'ang ma yin pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /

original: gal te rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /üîΩsdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: gal te rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: whether it is pleasant,

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin /üîΩbde ba'ang ma yin pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin / bde ba'ang ma yin pa la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /

analyzed: gal te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /

original: mig lnga dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
analyzed: mig lnga dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
translated: They are established in and know and believe in the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the six perfections, the four fearlessnesses, the four immeasurable thoughts, the four concentrations, the four formless absorptions, and the ten tathƒÅgata powers.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos /
translated: They are established in and know and believe in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la gnas shing kun tu shes te mos na /
translated: They are established in and know and believe in the dharmas of the arhats, the pratyekabuddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the buddhas.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa yin te /
translated: They are practicing with a view to creating.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags @133a *//
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod pa ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags @133a *//
translated: Those who are practicing with a view to creating are born, age, get sick, die, grieve, and lament.

original: 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag las yongs su mi thar zhing /
analyzed: 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag las yongs su mi thar zhing /

analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa las yongs su mi 'grol lo //
translated: they will not be freed from suffering and so on.

analyzed: zhes kho bo smra'o //

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa mngon sum du bya ba'i skal ba'ang med na /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: so how could that bodhisattva possibly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood?

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is impossible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni thabs la mi mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni thabs la mi mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom like that is unskilled in means.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyod na /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: thabs mkhas par rig par bya /
analyzed: thabs mkhas par rig par bya /
translated: How should they be known to be skilled in means?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang gi tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gang gi tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
translated: and they do not practice feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan ma la mi spyod /
translated: They do not practice the causal signs of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan ma la @133b mi spyod; gzugs rtag ces bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan ma la @133b mi spyod; gzugs rtag ces bya bar mi spyod /
translated: and they do not practice the causal signs of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness. They do not practice that form is permanent,

original: de bzhin du gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar mi spyod /üîΩtshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar mi spyod / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang /
translated: Similarly, they do not engage with the idea that form is impermanent, or that it is a self, or not a self, or that it is empty, or not empty, or with the idea that it is afflicted, or purified, or that it is arising, or that it is ceasing.

original: bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar mi spyod /üîΩgzugs stong zhes bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya bar mi spyod / gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the idea that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are permanent or impermanent, or that they are a self or not a self, or that they are empty or not empty, or that they are afflicted or purified, or that they are arising or ceasing.

original: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the idea that form is empty or not empty, or that it has a sign or is signless, or that it has aspirations or is without aspirations.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the notion that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty,

original: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar mi spyod /
translated: or with the notion that they are not empty; or with the notion that they are with signs; or with the notion that they are signless; or with the notion that they are with aspirations; or with the notion that they are without aspirations.

original: gzugs dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the notion that form is calm or not calm.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben zhes bya bar mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben zhes bya bar mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the notion that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are calm or not calm.

original: mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: mi dben zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: If they do not engage with the notion that form is calm or not calm,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni thabs la mkhas par @134a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni thabs la mkhas par @134a *//
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known that bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that are skilled in means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin /üîΩstong pa nyid las gud na'ang gzugs med /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin / stong pa nyid las gud na'ang gzugs med /
translated: The emptiness of form is not form.üîΩForm is not other than emptiness.üîΩEmptiness is not other than form.

original: gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /
analyzed: gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /
translated: Form itself is emptiness.

original: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang; 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang rnam par shes pa ma yin /üîΩstong pa nyid las gud na'ang rnam par shes pa med /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang; 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de'ang rnam par shes pa ma yin / stong pa nyid las gud na'ang rnam par shes pa med /
translated: The emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /üîΩrnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de / rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not other than emptiness.üîΩEmptiness is not other than feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.üîΩFeeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness themselves are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Emptiness itself is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the perfections, the superknowledges, the powers of the tathƒÅgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma yin /üîΩstong pa nyid las gud na'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams med /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma yin / stong pa nyid las gud na'ang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams med /
translated: the fearlessnesses, the aspects of correct understanding, and the distinct qualities of the Buddha‚Äîthe emptiness of those is not the distinct qualities of the Buddha.üîΩThe distinct qualities of the Buddha are not other than emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos @134b rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /üîΩstong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos @134b rnams las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de / stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin la /
translated: Emptiness is not other than the distinct qualities of the Buddha.üîΩEmptiness is the distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The distinct qualities of the Buddha are emptiness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni thabs la mkhas par rig par bya'o //üîΩtshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained,

analyzed: khas mi len na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //üîΩkhas len kyang len la /
translated: If he does not accept any dharma, he does not course in the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIf he accepts or does not accept any dharma, he does not course in the perfection of wisdom.

original: khas mi len kyang mi len na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //üîΩkhas len pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: khas mi len kyang mi len na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no // khas len pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Even if they do not accept, they are not practicing the perfection of wisdom.üîΩEven if they do not accept, they are not practicing the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: khas mi len pa'ang ma yin na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: stong pa nyid kyang mig go /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mig go /

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi stong pa nyid kyis yid stong pa ma yin gyi /üîΩyid nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //

original: stong pa nyid kyang yid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid do //

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin gyi /

original: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong pa ma yin gyi /üîΩchos rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //

original: stong pa nyid kyang chos rnams so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang chos rnams so //

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //

original: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa'o //

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa ma yin gyi /

translated: It is not that the ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness are empty because of the emptiness of the mind consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The mind consciousness itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //

analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do // stong pa nyid @157a *//

original: kyang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'o //

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa ma yin gyi /üîΩyid kyi 'dus te reg pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa ma yin gyi / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and thinking-mind contact is not the emptiness of thinking-mind contact.üîΩThinking-mind contact itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //

analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i stong pa nyid kyis mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin gyi //
translated: It is not that the condition of contact at the eye is empty because of the emptiness of the condition of contact at the eye.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //

original: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i stong pa nyid kyis yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin gyi /

translated: It is not that the condition of contact at the ear, the condition of contact at the nose, the condition of contact at the tongue, the condition of contact at the body, and the condition of contact at the mind are empty because of the emptiness of the condition of contact at the mind.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams stong pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams stong pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The emptiness of the applications of mindfulness is not the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness.

analyzed: dran pa nye bar @157b bzhag pa rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams so //

translated: The emptiness of the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path is not the emptiness of the path.

original: lam nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The path itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang lam mo; ;stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar stong pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams stong pa ma yin gyi /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang lam mo; ;stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar stong pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams stong pa ma yin gyi / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: emptiness is the path, and the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the distinct attributes of a buddha are not empty of the distinct attributes of a buddha, but the distinct attributes of a buddha are emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o /

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i thabs la mkhas pa yin te /üîΩthabs de dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bstan pa 'di thos na mi skrag /

original: mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with that skillful means, when bodhisattva great beings hear this teaching they are not frightened, terrified, or become terrified.üîΩSubh≈´ti said,

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /üîΩbcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‚ÄúLord,

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang dag gis yongs su zin na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos na mi skrag /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag ni gang dag de la gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here the spiritual friends of a bodhisattva great being are those who teach the Dharma to him, saying, ‚ÄòForm is impermanent.‚Äô

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston cing /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston cing /

translated: The nine serial absorptions are as follows.üîΩWhat are the nine?üîΩThe first absorption is the attainment and abiding in the joy and bliss that arise from separation,üîΩwhich is free from the desires,üîΩfree from negative and nonvirtuous factors,üîΩand endowed with both ideation and scrutiny.üîΩThe second absorption is the attainment and abiding in the joy and bliss that arise from concentration,üîΩwhich is free from ideation and scrutiny, and endowed with an inner clarity and a one-pointed mind.üîΩThe third absorption is the attainment and abiding in the mindfulness and alertness that are free from joy,üîΩ Translation: ‡Ω†‡Ωë‡Ω¥‡ºã‡Ω§‡Ω∫‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ωë‡ΩÑ‡ºã‡Ωö‡Ωº‡Ω¢‡ºã‡Ωñ‡ºã‡Ω†‡ΩÇ‡Ωº‡ΩÇ‡ºã‡Ωî‡ºã‡Ω¶‡æí‡æ≤‡Ω¥‡Ωñ‡ºã‡Ωî‡ºã‡Ω£‡ºã‡Ωû‡Ω¥‡ΩÇ‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ωì‡Ω¶‡ºã‡ΩÇ‡Ωì‡Ω¶‡ºã‡Ωî‡ºã‡Ωì‡Ω≤‡ºã‡Ω¢‡æ£‡Ωò‡ºã‡Ωî‡Ω¢‡ºã‡Ωê‡Ω¢‡ºã‡Ωî‡ºã‡Ωñ‡Ω¢‡æí‡æ±‡Ωë‡ºã‡Ωî‡ºã‡Ω¶‡æü‡Ω∫‡ºç

original: de dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par thar pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: These are the eight liberations.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ste /
translated: the nine serial absorptions.üîΩüîΩ

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine?üîΩüîΩ

original: 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: It is free from desire.üîΩüîΩ

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
translated: It is free from negative, nonvirtuous factors.üîΩ

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: It is associated with investigation and analysis.üîΩ

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: They accomplish and abide in the first meditative concentration, which is endowed with ideation and scrutiny, and is accompanied by joy and pleasure born of seclusion.üîΩüîΩThey are free from ideation and scrutiny, and their mind is inwardly unified and concentrated.üîΩ

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
translated: It is nonconceptual because the mind is unified.

original: dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing /
translated: They accomplish and maintain the second meditative concentration, which is free of analysis and is endowed with joy and bliss born of meditative concentration.üîΩüîΩThey are free of attachment to joy and abide in equanimity.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: They are mindful and aware.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa @176b dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o //üîΩzhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa @176b dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o // zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: They experience bliss with their bodies and abide in equanimity, mindful and aware, as the noble ones describe it.

original: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bde ba'ang spangs /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bde ba'ang spangs /
translated: They accomplish and abide in the third meditative concentration, which is without joy but still has zest.

original: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing /
translated: They give up both pleasure and pain,

original: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'ang nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'ang nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: and with the disappearance of mental well-being and the disappearance of mental stress,üîΩthey experience neither pleasure nor pain in the fourth meditative concentration, which is accompanied by equanimity and mindfulness.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /üîΩthogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing; sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te / thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing; sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas /
translated: They completely transcend perceptions of form,üîΩperceptions of tangibility, and perceptions of variety,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
translated: and they do not pay attention to perceptions of infinite space.

original: snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /üîΩrnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
analyzed: snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te / rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄòThe sphere of infinite space is peaceful,‚Äô they achieve and maintain the sphere of infinite space.

original: snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /üîΩci'ang med do //
analyzed: snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te / ci'ang med do //
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄòConsciousness is infinite,‚Äô they achieve and maintain the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: snyam nas ci'ang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du ci'ang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas /üîΩ'du shes med /
analyzed: snyam nas ci'ang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rnam pa thams cad du ci'ang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas / 'du shes med /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄòThere is nothing whatsoever,‚Äô they achieve and maintain the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa @177a *//üîΩdang; de rnam pa thams cad du /üîΩ'du shes med /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas pa @177a *// dang; de rnam pa thams cad du / 'du shes med /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄòNeither with nor without ideation,‚Äô they achieve and maintain the sphere of neither with nor without ideation.

original: 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄòIdeation is stopped,‚Äô they achieve and maintain the sphere of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa bsgrubs nas gnas pa ste /
translated: and the attainment and abiding in the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
translated: These are the nine serial absorptions.

original: nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams te /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams te /
translated: The supramundane dharmas are the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all dharmas, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of the essential nature, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the supramundane dharmas.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the dharmas with outflows?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
translated: the five aggregates, the twelve sense fields, the eighteen elements, the four concentrations, the four immeasurable aspirations, and the four formless absorptions.

original: de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the dharmas with outflows.

original: de la zag pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the uncontaminated dharmas?

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: They are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the eightfold noble path,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par @177b rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par @177b rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditioned dharmas?

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / de ma yin pa gzhan gang dag 'dus byas su gtogs pa'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / de ma yin pa gzhan gang dag 'dus byas su gtogs pa'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang yin te /
translated: the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm; and any other phenomena that are included in the conditioned, up to and including the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called conditioned phenomena.

original: de la 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are unconditioned phenomena?‚Äù

original: chos gang dag la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar mi snang ba dag ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur bar mi snang ba dag ste /
translated: They are phenomena that do not appear to arise, to disintegrate, or to transform.

original: 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags zad pa dang / zhe sdang zad pa dang / gti mug zad pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang /
translated: They are the extinction of desire, the extinction of hatred, the extinction of delusion, suchness, unaltered suchness, the absence of other suchness, the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent,

original: chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: the reality of phenomena, the faultlessness of phenomena, and the limit of reality.

original: de dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called unconditioned phenomena.

original: de la thun mong gi chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thun mong gi chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the common phenomena?

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga ste /
translated: The four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the five kinds of supernormal knowledge.

original: de dag ni thun mong gi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni thun mong gi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the common phenomena.

original: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat are the uncommon phenomena?

original: byang @178a *// chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
analyzed: byang @178a *// chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ste /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening, the ten powers, the four kinds of fearlessness, the four kinds of exact knowledge, the three gateways to liberation, up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: de dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the uncommon phenomena.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: In this regard, Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad la rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la chags pa med pa dang / yod pa ma yin par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la chags pa med pa dang / yod pa ma yin par bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in nonattachment and nonexistence with regard to phenomena that are empty of their own marks, because all phenomena are nonconceptual and nonanalytical.

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i tshul du khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩde nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i tshul du khong du chud par bya'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: All phenomena should be understood in the manner of nonduality.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi ba ci'i slad du /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One,üîΩwhy is it called ‚Äòbodhisattva great being‚Äô?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called ‚Äòbodhisattva great being‚Äô?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ‚Äù The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi ris phal po che'i phul byed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can gyi phung po chen po dang / sems can gyi ris phal po che'i phul byed par 'gyur bas /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is because they will be the leaders of the great mass of beings, of the great assembly of beings.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' @178b sems dpa' chen po gang gi phul bgyid par 'gyur ba'i sems can gyi tshogs chen po ni gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @178b sems dpa' chen po gang gi phul bgyid par 'gyur ba'i sems can gyi tshogs chen po ni gang lags /

original: sems can gyi ris phal po che ni gang lags /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris phal po che ni gang lags /
translated: What is the great class of beings?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / sems can gyi tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems can gyi tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, a ‚Äògreat assembly of beings‚Äô

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang /
translated: the level of the lineage, the eighth, the stream enterer, the once-returner, the non-returner, the worthy one, the pratyekabuddha, the bodhisattva who has generated the first level of the mind,

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bar dag go /
translated: and the bodhisattva great being who is on the irreversible level.

original: rab 'byor / de ni sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi ris phal po che zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni sems can gyi tshogs chen po dang / sems can gyi ris phal po che zhes bya ste /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva

original: de'i phul byed par 'gyur ro //

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rdo rje lta bu'i sems bskyed de /
